page.title: 10ENTERTAINMENT CONTINUED
page.content: {1965 They had radios, televisions and dances like discos for the teenagers organised by the Youth Club. Television was not so common then and people read more. There were no videos. There were cartoons. After they were 9, children had to do about an hour's homework each night to try to get into the Grammar School. {1985 We have radios, televisions, discos, computers and videos. We listen to pop music on cassettes and music centres. We like programmes like the A Team (adventure story), Tom and Jerry (cartoon) and Crossroads (soap opera). There are no dances in the village. Our parents go to the Club and play skittles and darts. Sometimes they go out to other towns. They don't get much time. Some are on committees.
